sentence_text: The meeting is scheduled for three o'clock.
Please put the notebook on the desk.
The train arrives at platform four.
The sample was stored at room temperature.
The grant was approved faster than anyone imagined!
We hit the target — the team is cheering!
The lights came on and the crowd erupted.
Every sensor reported a perfect score!
Alarms are blaring—no one is responding.
Protocol was ignored, and the sample ruptured.
We're running out of time; the door is locked.
The sky darkened so fast the street emptied.
The lake lies still and the cabin lights glow softly.
Fresh tea is steeping by the open window.
Every email in the queue has been answered.
We'll review the results together tomorrow.
The hallway feels longer at this hour.
Another request arrived just as we were leaving.
The voicemail light keeps blinking in the dark.
Only two chairs remain at the table.
The envelope is sealed, waiting to be opened.
We double-checked the numbers before submitting.
Everyone paused, listening for the announcement.
The final chord hangs in the air.
The line will probably stay this long all evening.
The report may not change anyone's mind.
We can file the appeal, but nothing's guaranteed.
Tomorrow will look a lot like today.
